business.headline: Paytm shares rally 18% in last-hour surge: Is there more upside? Despite the rally in shares, Paytm's stock is still down 24.51% from its 52-week high of Rs 998.30, recorded on August 20, 2023.

More trouble for Ola Electric, transport ministry to investigate complaintsThe complaints against Ola Electric have been growing in recent months, with issues ranging from service quality, customer support, to product reliability.
Sensex, Nifty end higher led by auto and financial; Paytm shares jump 16%The S&P BSE Sensex added 584.81 points to end at 81,634.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 217.40 points to close at 25,013.15.

Tata Group stock falls 4% as Jhunjhunwala eyes exit from multibaggerThe Jhunjhunwala family first invested in Tata Motors in the September 2020 quarter, when Rakesh Jhunjhunwala picked up 4 crore shares of the company

Explained: Why SpiceJet shares jumped 9% todaySpiceJet recently raised Rs 3,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP). The airline is also set to receive an additional Rs 736 crore from a previous funding round, which will help support its growth plans.

Cognizant favoured H-1B holders over non-Indian workers, says US juryThis case dates back to 2017 when a class-action lawsuit was filed against the IT giant, accusing it of bias in its employment practices.
Crude oil prices seem to stabilise as all-out war fears recedeTensions between Israel and Iran led to a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in the past seven days.

Stock market reacts to China stimulus: Is there further dip in Sensex, Nifty?Despite some analysts hoping that foreign portfolio investment (FPI) outflows from India might reverse, further declines in Indian stocks cannot be dismissed, as per experts.
Ola Electric shares fall 6% after show cause notice; drops 46% from peakOla Electric has been given 15 days to respond to the notice and will provide the required documents within that time frame.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as global uncertainty fuels cautious sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 321.03 points to 81,371.03, while the Nifty50 added 73.45 points to 24,869.20.

Central panel's notice to Ola after surge in complaints against EVs: SourcesThe Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has taken cognisance of thousands of complaints and issued a show-cause notice to Ola Electric, sources said.

RBI MPC: Is rate cut on card? Shaktikanta Das to announce soonSpeculation has grown about the possibility of a rate cut or a shift in monetary policy, especially after the US Federal Reserve delivered an unexpected 50-basis-point cut in September 2024.

Zepto shifting its base to Total Mall in Sarjapur, Bengaluru: ReportZepto had earlier asked its 1,700-1,800 employees to move from its current base in Powai, Mumbai, to Bengaluru. However, the timeline was pushed back due to delays in finalising an appropriate location.
Sensex, Nifty close in red despite IT boost; global factors weigh heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 638.45 points to end at 81,050, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 218.85 points to close at 24,795.75.

Explained: Why NBCC India shares are falling 30% on mobile trading appsThe company has performed well in recent times, with its shares increasing by 109% in 2024 and a massive 192% over the last year.

Mark Zuckerberg flaunts 'his and her' Porsches, designs minivan for wifeZuckerberg posted photos and videos of a Porsche 911 GT3 with a touring package for himself, and a customised Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT Minivan for Priscilla.
RVNL, IRFC, IRCON: Railway stocks fall up to 8%. Check hereRailway stocks such as RVNL, IRFC, IRCON saw a decline on the stock exchanges on Monday.

Gold, silver price today, October 7, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 7, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Ola Electric shares tank 8% in early trade day after CEO's ugly spat with comicOla Electric shares have dropped 43% from its all-time high, and has seen a decline in five of the last six trading sessions.

Fashion venture on cards: Is Mark Zuckerberg shifting from tech to trendy? Known for his casual wardrobe, which usually includes plain grey t-shirts and hoodies, Zuckerberg is now adding a personal touch to his outfits.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Haryana Congress fight out in open after loss, Kumari Selja targets HoodasA blame game began in the Congress on Tuesday after it failed in its bid to come back to power in Haryana after 10 years.

Gujarat: Journalist Mahesh Langa arrested in GST fraud case, Rs 20 lakh seizedThe arrest came after the crime branch raided 14 places in Ahmedabad, Junagadh, Surat, Kheda and Bhavnagar following a complaint by the Central GST department.

Did 'Jat and Jaat' cost Congress Haryana?Haryana Election result 2024: With Bhupinder Hooda having his way in the Congress, the party largely banked upon the Jat community to thwart the BJP. However, the move seems to have alienated the Dalits as Kumari Selja stayed away from campaigning.

CM for just 200 days, Saini is Nayab for BJP in HaryanaNayab Singh Saini was brought in as Haryana Chief Minister around 200 days ahead of the Assembly election in the state. Saini, with his schemes, won people's confidence, and helped the BJP create history in Haryana, beating 10 years of anti-incumbency.
Space Station is leaking air and Nasa is worriedThe root cause of the leak remains under investigation, with both NASA and Roscosmos focusing on internal and external welds.

BJP close to Haryana hat-trick, NC-Congress crosses majority mark in J&KAssembly Election Results 2024 Live: Counting of votes for the high-stakes Assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir and Haryana is currently underway. As of 4.30 pm, the BJP is set for a hat-trick in Haryana, having won 27 seats, and leading on 22 seats. Meanwhile, in Jammu and Kashmir, the National Conference-Congress combine is set to form the government. The National Conference won on 41 seats and is leading on one seat, while the Congress secured victory on six seats. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates on Assembly election results.

'NC, how's the josh?' Beaming Abdullahs after victory in Jammu and KashmirNC leader Omar Abdullah's sister Safia Abdullah Khan asked enthusiastic party workers 'How's the josh' as the party, which is allied with Congress, tasted victory in the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly polls.

Assembly polls: 'Doda barfi' for AAP in Jammu and Kashmir, zilch in HaryanaAssembly poll results: The AAP, which is in power in Punjab and Delhi, now has members in the legislative assemblies of Jammu and Kashmir, Goa, and Gujarat.

Godfather of AI has a stark warning after winning Nobel in PhysicsDuring a conference call following the announcement of his award, Hinton expressed serious concerns about the rapid advancement of AI technology.

More trouble for Ola Electric, transport ministry to investigate complaintsThe complaints against Ola Electric have been growing in recent months, with issues ranging from service quality, customer support, to product reliability.

BJP's Shagun Parihar, whose father was killed in terror attack, wins in KishtwarShagun Parihar's father, Ajit Parihar, and uncle, Anil Parihar, who was a district BJP leader, were killed by terrorists in November 2018.

Over 45 senior doctors resign from RG Kar in support of juniors' protestOver 45 senior doctors of RG Kar Medical College and Hospital have resigned, expressing solidarity with their junior colleagues who are protesting against the rape and murder of a trainee doctor in August this year.

National Film Awards 2024 Live: Rishab Shetty wins Best Actor for Kantara70th National Awards Ceremony 2024 Live Update: The prestigious National Film Awards ceremony was held in New Delhi. President Droupadi Murmu honoured artists for their exceptional work in Indian cinema.

Haryana Election Results 2024: Full list of constituency wise winnersHaryana Election Winners List 2024: After the huge turn of events, here is the full list of constituency-wise winners for Haryana Election Results 2024.
J&K Election Results 2024: Full list of constituency wise winnersJ&K Election Winners List 2024: Here is the full list of constituency-wise winners for Haryana Election Results 2024.

Setback for BJP in 2 key Hindu-majority seats in Jammu regionThe BJP lost to an Independent candidate from Bani Assembly seat in Jammu and Kashmir by 18,672 votes, while the party lost to the National Conference in Ramban by a margin of 8,869 votes.

The Tribe on Prime: If 'any resemblance to real is purely coincidental' had a face! The Tribe, available on Prime Video, is like the best of this glossy, entitled world which is not yours. It is based on the lives and 'struggles' of five young women who are established content creators in their own rights, and are now using their 'talents' to build an even greater audience. All in Los Angeles.

Ground report: Israelis take shelter as Hezbollah fires another rocket at HaifaA barrage of rockets launched by Hezbollah has struck central Israel's Haifa. India Today journalist, Gaurav Sawant, was on the ground in the city when a rocket alert was sounded, forcing him to seek immediate shelter. The attack occurred just 24 hours after the same high-rise building, where Sawant sought refuge, had been targeted by Hezbollah forces.

The relentless rocket attacks have driven people, including vulnerable senior citizens, to seek safety in bunkers. Strangers have come together, united by a shared urgency to survive, as the city's warning sirens blare, signalling the threat of incoming rockets.

Irresponsible, unfounded: Election Commission on Congress's counting delay chargeHaryana Assembly Election Result: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh claimed that there was delay in uploading of up-to-date trends for Haryana election results on the Election Commission website. However, the poll panel refuted the claim as "irresponsible and unfounded".

Congress's Vinesh Phogat wins debut election from Haryana's JulanaWrestler Vinesh Phogat won the Julana seat in the Haryana Assembly election, defeating BJP's Yogesh Kumar by over 6,015 votes in her debut election.

Tillotama Shome recalls attending award shows as plus one: Felt sorry for myselfTillotama Shome reflects on her journey from feeling like an outsider at award shows to gaining recognition after her breakthrough in Sir. Her web series, The Night Manager, has been nominated for the International Emmy Awards.

Omar Abdullah will be chief minister: Farooq Abdullah says J&K's mandate clearNational Conference chief Farooq Abdullah said the people of Jammu and Kashmir have given their mandate and his son Omar will be the next chief minister.

Never be overconfident, says Arvind Kejriwal as AAP draws blank in HaryanaArvind Kejriwal, reacting to AAP's poor performance in the Haryana Assembly elections where the BJP is poised for a third-term victory, said the "biggest lesson" is to never be overconfident in elections.

Jr NTR and Koratala Siva reveal why Daavudi song was removed from DevaraJr NTR and Koratala Siva, in a recent interview, explained that it was a difficult decision to omit the Daavudi song from Devara: Part 1 to maintain the emotional flow of the story. But they ultimately decided to add it back in response to the growing demand from fans.

Manoj Bajpayee on Gulmohar's National Award: An important film on filial tiesThe versatile Manoj Bajpayee recently opened up about his film Gulmohar, which has won 2 National Awards along with a special mention for the lead star.

sports.headline: Watch: Tip-toeing Chris Woakes nearly pulls off sensational catch in Multan TestEngland seamer Chris Woakes nearly pulled off a sensational catch against Pakistan on Tuesday, October 8. Woakes, while tip-toeing at the boundary almost managed to dismiss Salman Agha on Day 2 of the 1st Test in Multan.

Arshdeep Singh finds right pace to enjoy flourishing India career in the fast laneSpeaking to the press in New Delhi ahead of the second T20I between India and Bangladesh, Arshdeep Singh said he has learnt the importance of staying in the present and riding the highs and lows of the sport. Arshdeep has evolved into one of the leading bowlers for India in T20Is with speculation about a potential place in the Test side

Arshdeep Singh plays down speculation about Test selection for Australia tourArshdeep Singh has played down speculation over his selection in the Test team for the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. He is currently leading India's bowling attack for the T20I series against Bangladesh.
Mahmudullah announces T20I retirement, to hang up boots after India seriesBangladesh's all-rounder Mahmudullah has announced that he will retire from T20Is after the three-match series against India.

Arshdeep Singh needs time before transitioning to Test cricket: RP Singh Former India seamer RP Singh in an exclusive interaction with India Today, opined Arshdeep Singh should focus on white-ball cricket for now, suggesting that he needs more time to transition into Test cricket, despite his recent T20I successes.

He will 100% play ODI World Cup 2027, says Rohit Sharma's childhood coach Rohit Sharma's childhood coach, Dinesh Lad, believes that the Indian skipper will continue playing ODIs until the 2027 World Cup. Rohit recently announced his retirement from T20Is after leading India to the T20 World Cup 2024 triumph.

Will Nitish Rana be retained by KKR? Player yet to receive call from franchiseKKR batter Nitish Rana has hoped that he can extend his stay at Kolkata Knight Riders. Rana, who has been at KKR for 7 years has revealed that he has received no communication if he will be retained or let go from the franchise.

Bowling consultant James Anderson joins England in Multan after golf criticismPakistan vs England, 1st Test: Bowling consultant James Anderson joined the England team in Multan on Day 2 of the series opener. Anderson's absence was questioned after he was spotted playing golf in Scotland earlier in the month.

Pro Kabaddi League: Guman Singh main man in Gujrat Giants's chase for titleGujarat Giants are aiming for their first PKL title in Season 11, relying on a strong raiding unit led by Guman Singh, but concerns over inexperience in defence could hinder their chances of going the distance.

Mayank Yadav for Border Gavaskar Trophy? Basit Ali's wish after pacer's debutFormer Pakistan batter Basit Ali has claimed that he wants to see Mayank Yadav in the India squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. Mayank made his India debut in fine fashion.

Former England and Sri Lanka coach Silverwood joins Sharjah WarriorzSharjah Warriorz appointed Chris Silverwood as their new bowling coach for ILT20. The former England and Sri Lanka head coach will team up with JP Duminy to bolster the coaching setup ahead of the upcoming season.

Season 11: Pardeep Narwal-powered Bengaluru Bulls eye playoffsBengaluru Bulls will be aiming to get back into the mix for the playoffs during season 11 of the Pro Kabaddi League and they will look to the returning Pardeep Narwal to lead their charge.

Paralympic champion Nitesh Kumar demands transparency from BAIIndian badminton won a total of 5 medals at the Paris Paralympics. While the Badminton Association of India announced cash prices for the medallists, gold medallist Nitesh Kumar says there is much to be desired from the BAI in terms of welfare of the athletes.

T20 World Cup pitches not suiting Shafali Verma, Smriti Mandhana: ManjrekarWomen's T20 World Cup: Top India batters Shafali Verma and Smriti Mandhana are struggling in the tournament because the UAE pitches are not suiting them, feels Sanjay Manjrekar. Both batters struggled to play their natural attacking styles in the first 2 games.

Sarfaraz Khan to miss Mumbai's Ranji Trophy opener, set for IND vs NZ seriesSarfaraz Khan is all set to be retained in the India squad for the New Zealand series and miss Mumbai opening match of the Ranji Trophy against Baroda, according to the latest reports.

Lionel Messi pens special message to Andres Iniesta on retirementLionel Messi shared a touching tribute to his former Barcelona teammate Andrés Iniesta, as the Spanish legend announced his retirement, celebrating their iconic partnership and Iniesta's incredible footballing legacy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
